js.user
Class JsCanvasRenderingContext2D

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      js.Var<JsObject>
          js.core.JsObject
              js.dom.DOM.CanvasRenderingContext2D.Prototype
                  js.user.JsCanvasRenderingContext2D
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObjectLike
public class JsCanvasRenderingContext2D
extends DOM.CanvasRenderingContext2D.Prototype

An opaque class representing client-side objects of the JavaScript global JsClient.CanvasRenderingContext2D class.

An object of this type provides a set of graphics functions to draw on a canvas.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
JavaScript:
Opaque types can be resolved but no class objects for them can be generated into the target codes. Re-compilers must exit with error on the operations of accessing that kind of class objects. The checkcast operation to the class literal of this interface must be ignored and instanceof to it always true.

Field Detail

COMPOSITE_COPY

public static final java.lang.String COMPOSITE_COPY

Draws only the new shape, removing everything else.

This constant is a legal value for the globalCompositeOperation property of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object indicating how colors being drawn are combined with colors that already exist on the canvas.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

COMPOSITE_DARKER

public static final java.lang.String COMPOSITE_DARKER

Where both shapes overlap, the color is determined by subtracting color values.

This constant is a legal value for the globalCompositeOperation property of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object indicating how colors being drawn are combined with colors that already exist on the canvas.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_ATOP

public static final java.lang.String COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_ATOP

Existing content is kept only where it overlaps the new shape. The new shape is drawn behind the content.

This constant is a legal value for the globalCompositeOperation property of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object indicating how colors being drawn are combined with colors that already exist on the canvas.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_IN

public static final java.lang.String COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_IN

Existing content is kept where both the new shape and existing canvas content overlap. Everything else is made transparent.

This constant is a legal value for the globalCompositeOperation property of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object indicating how colors being drawn are combined with colors that already exist on the canvas.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_OUT

public static final java.lang.String COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_OUT

Existing content is kept where it doesn't overlap the new shape. Everything else is made transparent.

This constant is a legal value for the globalCompositeOperation property of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object indicating how colors being drawn are combined with colors that already exist on the canvas.

Since:
1.0

COMPOSITE_SOURCE_OVER

public static final java.lang.String COMPOSITE_SOURCE_OVER

The new shape is drawn on top of existing content. This is the default behavior.

This constant is a legal value for the globalCompositeOperation property of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object indicating how colors being drawn are combined with colors that already exist on the canvas.

COMPOSITE_XOR

public static final java.lang.String COMPOSITE_XOR

Shapes are made transparent where both overlap and drawn normal everywhere else.

This constant is a legal value for the globalCompositeOperation property of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object indicating how colors being drawn are combined with colors that already exist on the canvas.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

LINECAP_BUTT

public static final java.lang.String LINECAP_BUTT

This default value specifies that the line should have no cap. The end of the line is straight and is perpendicular to the direction of the line. The line is not extended beyond its end-point.

This constant is a legal value for the lineCap property of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object indicating how how lines should be terminated.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

LINECAP_ROUND

public static final java.lang.String LINECAP_ROUND

Specifies that lines should be capped with a semi-circle whose diameter is equal to the width of the line and which extends beyond the end of the line by one half the width of the line.

This constant is a legal value for the lineCap property of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object indicating how how lines should be terminated.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

LINECAP_SQUARE

public static final java.lang.String LINECAP_SQUARE

Specifies that lines should be capped with a rectangle. This value is like "butt", but the line is extended by half of its width.

This constant is a legal value for the lineCap property of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object indicating how how lines should be terminated.

Since:
1.0
See Also:

Constant Field Values

globalAlpha

public static final Value.Number.Member globalAlpha

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a float value specifying the opacity of content drawn on the canvas. The range of values is between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (no additional transparency). The default value for the property is 1.0.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

globalCompositeOperation

public static final Value.String.Member globalCompositeOperation

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a string specifying how colors being drawn are combined (or "composited") with colors that already exist on the canvas. The following are the possible values and their meanings. The word source in the these values refers to the colors being drawn onto the canvas, and the word destination refers to the existing colors on the canvas. The default is COMPOSITE_SOURCE_OVER.

  • COMPOSITE_COPY
  • COMPOSITE_DARKER
  • COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_ATOP
  • COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_IN
  • COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_OUT
  • COMPOSITE_DESTINATION_OVER
  • COMPOSITE_LIGHTER
  • COMPOSITE_SOURCE_ATOP
  • COMPOSITE_SOURCE_IN
  • COMPOSITE_SOURCE_OUT
  • COMPOSITE_SOURCE_OVER
  • COMPOSITE_XOR

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

lineCap

public static final Value.String.Member lineCap

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a string value specifying how lines should be terminated. It matters only when drawing wide lines. Legal values for the property are listed as follows. The default value is LINECAP_BUTT.

  • LINECAP_BUTT
  • LINECAP_ROUND
  • LINECAP_SQUARE

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

lineJoin

public static final Value.String.Member lineJoin

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a string value specifying how two lines are joined. Legal values are LINEJOIN_MITER, LINEJOIN_MITER, and LINEJOIN_MITER. The default is LINEJOIN_MITER.

When a path includes vertices where line segments and/or curves meet, this property specifies how those vertices are drawn. The effect of this property is apparent only when drawing with wide lines.

The default value of the property is LINEJOIN_MITER, which specifies that the outside edges of the two line segments are extended until they intersect. When two lines meet at an acute angle, mitered joins can become quite long. The miterLimit property places an upper bound on the length of a miter. Beyond this limit, the miter is beveled off.

The value LINEJOIN_ROUND specifies that the outside edges of the vertex should be joined with a filled arc whose diameter is equal to the width of the line.

The value LINEJOIN_BEVEL specifies that the outside edges of the vertex should be joined with a filled triangle.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

lineWidth

public static final Value.Number.Member lineWidth

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a float value specifying the line width for stroking (line drawing) operations. The default is 1.0, and this property must be greater than 0.0. Wide lines are centered over the path, with half of the line width on each side.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

miterLimit

public static final Value.Number.Member miterLimit

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a float value specifying the maximum ratio of miter length to line width when the lineJoin property is LINEJOIN_MITER.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

shadowBlur

public static final Value.Number.Member shadowBlur

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a float value specifying how much feathering shadows should have. The default is 0.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

shadowColor

public static final Value.String.Member shadowColor

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a string value specifying the color of shadows as a CSS or web style string and may include an alpha component for transparency. The default is black.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

shadowOffsetX

public static final Value.Number.Member shadowOffsetX

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a float value specifying the horizontal offset of the shadows. Larger values make the shadowed object appear to float higher above the background. The default is 0.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

shadowOffsetY

public static final Value.Number.Member shadowOffsetY

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to a float value specifying the vertical offset of the shadows. Larger values make the shadowed object appear to float higher above the background. The default is 0.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:

canvas

public static final JsHTMLCanvasElement.Member canvas

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object is a read-only reference to the JsHTMLCanvasElement element upon which this context will draw.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

fillStyle

public static final Value.Member<java.lang.Object> fillStyle

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to the current color, pattern, or gradient used for filling paths. The property may be set to a string or to a JsCanvasGradient or JsCanvasPattern object. When set to a string, it is parsed as a CSS color value and used for solid fills. When set to a JsCanvasGradient or JsCanvasPattern object, fills are done using the specified gradient or pattern.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
createLinearGradient(Number, Number, Number, Number), createPattern(JsHTMLCanvasElement, String), createPattern(JsHTMLImageElement, String), createRadialGradient(Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

strokeStyle

public static final Value.Member<java.lang.Object> strokeStyle

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object refers to the color, pattern, or gradient used for stroking (drawing) paths. The property may be set to a string or to a JsCanvasGradient or JsCanvasPattern object. When set to a string, it is parsed as a CSS color value and used for solid fills. When set to a JsCanvasGradient or JsCanvasPattern object, fills are done using the specified gradient or pattern.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
createLinearGradient(Number, Number, Number, Number), createPattern(JsHTMLCanvasElement, String), createPattern(JsHTMLImageElement, String), createRadialGradient(Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

public final JsHTMLCanvasElement var(JsHTMLCanvasElement.Member r)

arc

public final void arc(java.lang.Number x,
                      java.lang.Number y,
                      java.lang.Number r,
                      java.lang.Number a1,
                      java.lang.Number a2,
                      java.lang.Boolean c)

Adds an arc to the current sub-path of a canvas, using a center point and radius.

The first five arguments to this method specify a start point and an end point on the circumference of a circle. Invoking this method adds a straight line between the current point and the start point to the current sub-path. Next it adds the arc along the circumference of the circle between the start and end points to the sub-path. The final argument specifies the direction in which the circle should be traversed to connect the start and end points. This method leaves the current point set to the end point of the arc.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the center of the circle describing the arc.
y - The Y coordinate of the center of the circle describing the arc.
r - The radius of the circle that defines the arc.
a1 - Specifies the start point of the arc along the circle. The angles is measured in radians. The three o'clock position along the positive X axis is an angle of 0, and angles increase in the clockwise direction.
a2 - Specifies the end point of the arc along the circle. The angle is measured in radians. The three o'clock position along the positive X axis is an angle of 0, and angles increase in the clockwise direction.
c - Whether the arc is traversed counterclockwise (true) or clockwise (false) along the circle's circumference.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
arcTo(Number, Number, Number, Number, Number), beginPath(), closePath()
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

arcTo

public final void arcTo(java.lang.Number x1,
                        java.lang.Number y1,
                        java.lang.Number x2,
                        java.lang.Number y2,
                        java.lang.Number r)

Adds an arc to the current sub-path, using tangent points and a radius.

This method adds an arc to the current sub-path but describes that arc much differently than the arc(Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Boolean) method does. The arc that is added to the path by this method is a portion of a circle with the specified radius. The arc has one point tangent to the line from the current position to the point (x1, y1) and one point that is tangent to the line from the point (x1, y1) to the point (x2, y2). The arc begins and ends at these two tangent points and is drawn in the direction that connects those two points with the shortest arc.

In many common uses, the arc begins at the current position and ends at the point (x2, y2), but this is not always the case. If the current position is not the same as the starting point of the arc, this method adds a straight line from the current position to the start position of the arc. This method always leaves the current position set to the end point of the arc.

Parameters:
x1 - The X coordinate of the control point associated with the arc's start point.
y1 - The Y coordinate of the control point associated with the arc's start point.
x2 - The X coordinate of the control point associated with the arc's end point.
y2 - The Y coordinate of the control point associated with the arc's end point.
r - The radius of the circle that defines the arc.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
arc(Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Boolean)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

beginPath

public final void beginPath()

Starts a new path (or a collection of sub-paths) in a canvas.

This method discards any currently defined path and begins a new one. It sets the current point to (0,0).

When the context for a canvas is first created, this method is implicitly called.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
closePath(), fill(), stroke()
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

bezierCurveTo

public final void bezierCurveTo(java.lang.Number x1,
                                java.lang.Number y1,
                                java.lang.Number x2,
                                java.lang.Number y2,
                                java.lang.Number x,
                                java.lang.Number y)

Adds a cubic Bézier curve to the current sub-path.

The start point of the curve is the current point of the canvas, and the end point is (x,y). The two Bezier control points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) define the shape of the curve. When this method returns, the current position is (x,y).

Parameters:
x1 - The X coordinate of the control point associated with the curve's start point (the current position).
y1 - The Y coordinate of the control point associated with the curve's start point (the current position).
x2 - The X coordinate of the control point associated with the curve's end point.
y2 - The Y coordinate of the control point associated with the curve's end point.
x - The X coordinate of the curve's end point.
y - The Y coordinate of the curve's end point.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
quadraticCurveTo(Number, Number, Number, Number)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

clearRect

public final void clearRect(java.lang.Number x,
                            java.lang.Number y,
                            java.lang.Number w,
                            java.lang.Number h)

Erases the pixels in a rectangular area of a canvas.

This method erases the specified rectangle, filling it with a transparent color.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
y - The Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
w - The X dimension of the rectangle.
h - The Y dimension of the rectangle.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

clip

public final void clip()

Uses the current path as the clipping region for subsequent drawing operations.

This method clips the current path using the current clipping path and then uses the clipped path as the new clipping path. Note that there is no way to enlarge the clipping path. If you want a temporary clipping path, you should first call save() in order to use restore() to restore the original clipping path. The default clipping path for a canvas is the canvas rectangle itself.

This method resets the current path so that it is empty.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

closePath

public final void closePath()

Closes the current sub-path if it's open.

If the current sub-path of the canvas is open, this method closes it by adding a line connecting the current point to the sub-path's starting point. If the sub-path is already closed, this method does nothing. Once a sub-path is closed, no more lines or curves can be added to it. To continue adding to the path, you must begin a new sub-path by calling moveTo(Number, Number).

You do not need to call closePath() before stroking or filling a path. Paths are implicitly closed when filled (and also when you call clip()).

Since:
1.0
See Also:
beginPath(), moveTo(Number, Number), stroke(), fill()
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

createLinearGradient

public final JsCanvasGradient createLinearGradient(java.lang.Number x1,
                                                   java.lang.Number y1,
                                                   java.lang.Number x2,
                                                   java.lang.Number y2)

Returns a JsCanvasGradient object that represents a linear color gradient.

This method creates and returns a new JsCanvasGradient object that linearly interpolates colors between the specified start point and end point. Note that this method does not specify any colors for the gradient. Use the JsCanvasGradient.addColorStop(Number, String) method of the returned object to do that. To stroke lines or fill areas using a gradient, assign a JsCanvasGradient object to the strokeStyle or fillStyle properties.

Parameters:
x1 - The X coordinate of the gradient's start point.
y1 - The Y coordinate of the gradient's start point.
x2 - The X coordinate of the gradient's end point.
y2 - The Y coordinate of the gradient's end point.
Returns:
A JsCanvasGradient object representing the linear color gradient.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
createRadialGradient(Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

createRadialGradient

public final JsCanvasGradient createRadialGradient(java.lang.Number x1,
                                                   java.lang.Number y1,
                                                   java.lang.Number r1,
                                                   java.lang.Number x2,
                                                   java.lang.Number y2,
                                                   java.lang.Number r2)

Returns a JsCanvasGradient object that represents a radial color gradient.

This method creates and returns a new JsCanvasGradient object that radially interpolates colors between the circumferences of the two specified circles. Note that this method does not specify any colors for the gradient. Use the JsCanvasGradient.addColorStop(Number, String) method of the returned object to do that. To stroke lines or fill areas using a gradient, assign a JsCanvasGradient object to the strokeStyle or fillStyle properties.

Parameters:
x1 - The X coordinate of the center of the starting circle.
y1 - The Y coordinate of the center of the starting circle.
r1 - The radius of the starting circle.
x2 - The X coordinate of the center of the ending circle.
y2 - The Y coordinate of the center of the starting circle.
r2 - The radius of the ending circle.
Returns:
A JsCanvasGradient object representing the radial color gradient.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
createLinearGradient(Number, Number, Number, Number)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

createPattern

public final JsCanvasPattern createPattern(JsHTMLImageElement image,
                                           java.lang.String repeat)

Returns a JsCanvasPattern object that represents a tiled image.

This method creates and returns a new JsCanvasPattern object that represents the pattern defined by a tiled image. To use a pattern for stroking lines or filling areas, use a JsCanvasPattern object as the value of the strokeStyle or fillStyle properties.

Parameters:
image - The image to be tiled. This argument is typically JsHTMLImageElement object, but you may also use a JsHTMLCanvasElement element (see createPattern(JsHTMLCanvasElement, String)).
repeat - Specifies how the image is tiled. The possible values are the following:
  • "repeat": Tile the image in both directions. This is the default.
  • "repeat-x": Tile the image in the X dimension only.
  • "repeat-y": Tile the image in the Y dimension only.
  • "no-repeat": Do not tile the image; use it a single time only.
Returns:
A JsCanvasPattern object representing the pattern.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
createPattern(JsHTMLCanvasElement, String)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

  • "repeat": Tile the image in both directions. This is the default.
  • "repeat-x": Tile the image in the X dimension only.
  • "repeat-y": Tile the image in the Y dimension only.
  • "no-repeat": Do not tile the image; use it a single time only.
Returns:

drawImage

public final void drawImage(JsHTMLImageElement image,
                            java.lang.Number x,
                            java.lang.Number y)

Draws an image.

This method copies the entire image to the canvas, placing its upper-left corner at the specified point and mapping each image pixel to one unit in the canvas coordinate system.

Parameters:
image - The image to be drawn. This argument may also be a JsHTMLCanvasElement object.
x - The X coordinate of the point at which the upper-left corner of the image is drawn.
y - The Y coordinate of the point at which the upper-left corner of the image is drawn.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
drawImage(JsHTMLCanvasElement, Number, Number), drawImage(JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number, Number, Number), drawImage(JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number)

drawImage

public final void drawImage(JsHTMLImageElement image,
                            java.lang.Number x,
                            java.lang.Number y,
                            java.lang.Number w,
                            java.lang.Number h)

Draws an image.

This method copies the entire image to the canvas and allows you to specify the desired width and height of the image in canvas units.

Parameters:
image - The image to be drawn. This argument may also be an JsHTMLCanvasElement object.
x - The X coordinate of the point at which the upper-left corner of the image is drawn.
y - The Y coordinate of the point at which the upper-left corner of the image is drawn.
w - The width at which the image should be drawn. Specifying this argument causes the image to be scaled.
h - The height at which the image should be drawn. Specifying this argument causes the image to be scaled.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
drawImage(JsHTMLCanvasElement, Number, Number, Number, Number), drawImage(JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number), drawImage(JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number)

drawImage

public final void drawImage(JsHTMLImageElement image,
                            java.lang.Number x1,
                            java.lang.Number y1,
                            java.lang.Number w1,
                            java.lang.Number h1,
                            java.lang.Number x2,
                            java.lang.Number y2,
                            java.lang.Number w2,
                            java.lang.Number h2)

Draws an image.

This method allows you to specify any rectangular region of the image and copy it, with arbitrary scaling to any position within the canvas.

Parameters:
image - The image to be drawn. This argument may also be an JsHTMLCanvasElement object.
x1 - The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the region of the image that is to be drawn. This argument must be an integer measured in image pixels.
y1 - The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the region of the image that is to be drawn. This argument must be an integer measured in image pixels.
w1 - The X dimension, in image pixels, of the region of the image that is to be drawn.
h1 - The Y dimension, in image pixels, of the region of the image that is to be drawn.
x2 - The canvas X coordinate at which the upper-left corner of the image region is to be drawn.
y2 - The canvas Y coordinate at which the upper-left corner of the image region is to be drawn.
w2 - The canvas X dimension at which the image region should be drawn.
h2 - The canvas Y dimension at which the image region should be drawn.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
drawImage(JsHTMLCanvasElement, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number), drawImage(JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number), drawImage(JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number, Number, Number)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

fillRect

public final void fillRect(java.lang.Number x,
                           java.lang.Number y,
                           java.lang.Number w,
                           java.lang.Number h)

Paints or fills a rectangle.

This method fills the specified rectangle with the color, gradient, or pattern specified by the fillStyle property.

Current implementations of this method also clear the path as if beginPath() had been called. This surprising behavior may not be standardized and should not be relied on.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
y - The Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
w - The X dimension of the rectangle.
h - The Y dimension of the rectangle.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
fill(), rect(Number, Number, Number, Number), strokeRect(Number, Number, Number, Number)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

public final void lineTo(java.lang.Number x,
                         java.lang.Number y)

Adds a straight line segment to the current sub-path.

This method adds a straight line to the current sub-path. The line begins at the current point and ends at (x,y).

When this method returns, the current position is (x,y).

moveTo

public final void moveTo(java.lang.Number x,
                         java.lang.Number y)

Sets the current position and begins a new sub-path.

This method sets the current position to (x,y) and creates a new sub-path with this as its first point. If there was a previous sub-path and it consisted of just one point, that sub-path is removed from the path.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the new current point.
y - The Y coordinate of the new current point.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
beginPath()
JavaScript:

quadraticCurveTo

public final void quadraticCurveTo(java.lang.Number cx,
                                   java.lang.Number cy,
                                   java.lang.Number x,
                                   java.lang.Number y)

Adds a quadratic Bézier curve to the current sub-path.

This method adds a quadratic Bézier curve segment to the current sub-path. The curve starts at the current point and ends at (x,y). The control point (cx, cy) specifies the shape of the curve between these two points.

When this method returns, the current position is (x,y).

Parameters:
cx - The X coordinate of the control point.
cy - The Y coordinate of the control point.
x - The X coordinate of the end point.
y - The Y coordinate of the end point.

                       java.lang.Number y,
                       java.lang.Number w,
                       java.lang.Number h)

Adds a rectangle sub-path to the current path.

This method adds a rectangle to the path. This rectangle is in a sub-path of its own and is not connected to any other sub-paths in the path.

When this method returns, the current position is (0,0).

restore

public final void restore()

Resets the canvas to the graphics state most recently saved.

This method pops the stack of saved graphics states and restores the values of the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D properties, the clipping path, and the transformation matrix.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
save()
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

rotate

public final void rotate(java.lang.Number a)

Rotates the canvas.

This method alters the mapping between canvas coordinates and the pixels of the <canvas> element in the web browser so that any subsequent drawing appears rotated within the canvas by the specified angle. It does not rotate the <canvas> element itself.

Note that the angle is specified in radians. To convert degrees to radians, multiply by MathLike.PI and divide by 180.

Parameters:
a - The amount of rotation, in radians. Positive values result in clockwise rotation, and negative values result in counterclockwise rotation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
rotate(NumberLike), scale(Number, Number), translate(Number, Number)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

scale

public final void scale(java.lang.Number sx,
                        java.lang.Number sy)

Scales the user coordinate system of the canvas.

This method adds a scale transformation to the current transformation matrix of the canvas. Scaling is done with independent horizontal and vertical scaling factors.

Specifying a negative value for sx causes X coordinates to be flipped across the Y axis, and a negative value of sy causes Y coordinates to be flipped across the X axis.

Parameters:
sx - The horizontal scaling factor.
sy - The vertical scaling factor.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
rotate(Number), rotate(NumberLike), translate(Number, Number)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

stroke

public final void stroke()

Draws, or strokes, a line following the current path.

The line is drawn according to the lineWidth, lineJoin, lineCap, and strokeStyle properties, among others.

1.0
See Also:

Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

strokeRect

public final void strokeRect(java.lang.Number x,
                             java.lang.Number y,
                             java.lang.Number w,
                             java.lang.Number h)

Draws a rectangle without filling it.

This method draws the outline, but does not fill the interior, of a rectangle with the specified position and size. Line color and line width are specified by the strokeStyle and lineWidth properties. The appearance of the rectangle corners are specified by the lineJoin property.

Current implementations of this method clear the path as if beginPath() had been called. This surprising behavior may not be standardized and should not be relied on.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
y - The Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
w - The X dimension of the rectangle.
h - The Y dimension of the rectangle.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
fillRect(Number, Number, Number, Number), rect(Number, Number, Number, Number), stroke()
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

translate

public final void translate(java.lang.Number dx,
                            java.lang.Number dy)

Translates the user coordinate system of the canvas.

This method adds horizontal and vertical offsets to the transformation matrix of the canvas. The arguments dx and dy are added to all points in any subsequently defined paths.

Parameters:
dx - The amount to translate in the X dimension.
dy - The amount to translate in the Y dimension.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
rotate(Number), rotate(NumberLike), scale(Number, Number)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.
